title: 110_s3339
content: CLARIFICATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF AUTHORITIES RELATING TO POST-9/11 EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE FOR MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES AND VETERANS. Modification of Base Amounts of Educational Assistance under Section 3313(c)(1) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to set the maximum amount of established charges for full-time pursuit of approved programs of education for undergraduates at public institutions of higher learning in the State where the individual is enrolled. The maximum amount of established charges for full-time pursuit of approved programs of education for undergraduates at public institutions of higher learning in the State where the individual is enrolled is set to the highest rate among all public institutions in the State. The highest rate of established charges for approved undergraduate education programs at public institutions in the State where the individual is enrolled is determined. For students studying outside the United States, the average in-state charges for full-time pursuit of education are considered. The text chunk discusses the monthly housing stipend amount for students enrolled in higher education programs in the United States. It specifies the amount as equal to the basic allowance for housing under section 403 of title 37. The text chunk outlines the housing stipend for students enrolled in higher education programs, specifying the amount based on pay grade and location of the institution. The Secretary shall implement a program for colleges or universities to contribute towards education costs not covered by the GI Bill for eligible individuals. The program requires colleges or universities to match contributions towards education costs for eligible individuals. Participating institutions must offer the same percentage of additional assistance to all students and submit a report on how they will cover charges for individuals under the program. The program mandates colleges or universities to match contributions for eligible individuals pursuing education. The Secretary must receive a report on the amount of contribution from the institution for each individual. Matching contributions by the Secretary cannot exceed 50% of tuition and mandatory fees not covered elsewhere. Regulations for the program are also amended. The Secretary will prescribe regulations for the program required by the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will ensure implementation of the program and amendments by the effective date, including interim and final regulations as deemed appropriate. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on August 1, 2009, except for subsection (d) which will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
